text: Duncan Sutherland (1 August 1905 – 1967)Barr p.198was a Scottish-born art director, based in England where he designed the sets for over eighty films and television series between the early 1930s and mid-1960s. Sutherland spent much of the 1940s employed by Ealing Studios where he worked on films such as It Always Rains on Sunday and The Loves of Joanna Godden.Barr p.198 In the 1950s he began working on television series such as The Scarlet Pimpernel and The Count of Monte Cristo. ==Filmography== * After Office Hours (1932) * The Innocents of Chicago (1932) * The Last Coupon (1932) * On Secret
